lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome to tonight's adventure. Before we get into it, we're going to go ahead and go through our notes for sponsorship and other such glory for the evening. First and foremost, tonight, we have our fantastic returning sponsor, Lootcrate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you so much, Lootcrate. We have a glorious unboxing that is happening right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So wait. They've changed their boxes and their logos. I don't know if you guys noticed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think you mean upgraded. I can't open this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So wait, we're unboxing last month's box.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's for building a thing, isn't it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're correct, this was a bad point of entry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like a Batman loot container? Wait, wait, wait. Oh, slick.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can put your soup in it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can put your secret keys in there. Hide it in your front yard so nobody can take it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god, I got the Spaceman. Which one did you get?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yay, we have two Cyborgs for the home.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, yay. Who wants to trade me a Cyborg?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll trade you a Cyborg for a Spaceman.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god, this is actually--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We don't have to give these back, right? We can keep them?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did anybody show off the shirt, yet?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a really awesome Power Rangers shirt, with the classic Megazord.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm pretty sure that's Voltron, guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, what size do I have?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Guy with the comic book show?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got a large, never mind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's also something that tells me that I can unlock the mysteries.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, this is really cool, look at that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, 'How to build a tabletop RPG character'! That's very helpful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Please read that. I'm not even kidding. Read that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My favorite thing is the Batman head.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like, on the break, read it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sam, did you want to speak a little bit--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, and in pig latin, it's 'Am-say's ick-day is ig-bay'. All right, good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Send all your complaints care of Sam Riegel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you so much, Sam. And thank you, Lootcrate, for being our awesome sponsor. If the announcement sheet did go out today, I did not get it, so whoever put it together, if they could go find it real fast while I talk about--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I sent the announcement sheet to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I didn't get it in my e-mail.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let me find it on my--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know where my phone is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know what Daydream headsets are, but I bet you I know what they do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're VR, they're the VR headset.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They give you daydreams. From now through March 10, you can go to nerdist.com/powerrangersgiveaway to learn more and enter to win, and we kinda prefer to see Critters win anything that happens here--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To show those Nerdist guys what we mean here at Geek and Sundry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The other announcements, I'm trying to navigate Taliesin's phone, because I don't know where my phone is, so this is just going--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Taliesin's on an iPhone 2 over there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is just going great. Fuck it. We'll do it off the cuff.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well no, I remember some of them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One of them was Taliesin's announcement that he has some show on Wednesday nights.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do. Wednesday at noon to two on this very Twitch channel, is the Wednesday Club, and this week we're gonna be talking about Image Comics, which is now about 25 years old. This is the thing, and we're gonna talk about how they started and why it's important, and then all the cool stuff they're doing today, which is some really cool stuff. Good books.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's also a new Signal Boost, with Stefanie Woodburn and Eric Campbell is out-- ooh, there it is. Merch! Merch. Dice. Are out of stock.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The dice are out of stock, you guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't worry, we'll get like three more.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just felt like I needed a finale to that. Oh, GM Tips!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So check it out. Marisha, you--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You had an announcement, if I recall.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So if you walk into a Gamestop, you can see my dumb face talking to you about games and all that stuff, along with Chris, who's been there since the beginning, but yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're always a little kooky, Marisha.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like you were the harbinger of the end of the circle of life for Gamestop.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's like the ouroboros kinda thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know what I'm talking about.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And last but not least, as always, Talks Machina's live on Tuesday nights at 7PM on Twitch, with the illustrious Brian Foster. And don't forget, 'cause I feel like not a lot of people are doing this really, and I see so much, don't forget to submit your gif and fanart of the week to the contest, and use talksmachina@gmail.com to do that. Put it in the subject, be like, 'contest entry', because that helps people who are poring through your emails.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's it. That's all we have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. That being the case, let's go ahead--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Defeating them and sinking the ship, you continued forward, taking a prisoner.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A friendly prisoner. We're friendly taking a prisoner. Nicely taking a prisoner.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You then eventually found yourselves, the ship reaching the outside of the Anamn Mountains-- Anamn Islands. It's been a long week.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where the ship set anchor on the outside of the reefs that encircle the center of these three islands, where in the center of them lies a partially submerged city of Vesrah, the last stop on Keyleth's Aramente and the water ashari that live there. You, upon arriving just past sunset, watched the city come to life, and the Vesrah come out, and upon discovering that you were allies, or at least friendly, they took you in and gave you the idea of what you had to do to finish this Aramente. Your task, to come the following day, was to be led down into the Aerie of Torrent, where the elemental rift to the water elemental plane resides, under protection, and you were to retrieve three lodestones, magical stones that are occasionally farmed from the water elemental plane as they fade from power. These stones are utilized, apparently, in both keeping the rift contained and keeping the city of Vesrah aloft and up towards the air. However, in the process of them researching where these lodestones came from, it was discovered in the most recent years that they were byproducts of one of the krakens that lives in the water elemental plane, and--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a number of krakens. This one, however, was drawn back to the rift from one of the earlier expeditions of the Waveriders that were attempting to find them, and now has taken up its lair on the outskirts of this rift, so your task, as Vox Machina, is to enter the rift into the water elemental plane, find and bring back three of these lodestones, and do so without slaying the kraken, as it is an important part of the ecology and continued existence of the city of Vesrah. So. That's where we come up. So as it is evening, you've been fed, a largely fish- and marine-based meal, and you've had the opportunity to speak with some of the locals and prepare and discuss amongst yourselves exactly what you wish to do for this journey tomorrow. So.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So what time is it here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But I'd say it's about... maybe close to 10PM, the equivalent.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got here just after dusk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should have a Heroes' Feast before tomorrow. I have no idea what a kraken does, or--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Me neither. Actually, is Uvenda still around? She's still there, are we still in front of her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Uvenda is around, yeah. You can find her. As you approach her, she's finished her meal and is half-napping in this, almost a high chair, though it's built beautifully of what look to be petrified bleach-white shells and coral structures. This looks to be her seat at this open natural gazebo-like eating space. She's half-resting off to the side with her staff, leaning off a bit, and as you start approaching, one eye flies open and rolls in your direction, and she leans forward. "Young Keyleth. What do you require?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry. I hope I'm not interrupting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My nap, yes, but you seem intent. What do you wish?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there anything I should know in particular about the kraken?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "From what we know, the kraken is a very hungry beast. It carries with it a swarm of long, "grasping tentacles. It moves unimpeded and destroys structures in its path. Seems "nigh-unstoppable, which is why maintaining the rift is so important. To unleash more of these "entities into our plane would be disastrous, not just for our city, but for the entirety of the "Ozmit. Do be aware that you will be encountering this beast deep, deep in the fathomless depths of "the water elemental plane, so be prepared best you can to swim."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Anything that crosses its path. You'll see, the sand below the vicinity of the rift is "partially soot, dirt, and sand, but a lot of it is sprinkled bone "of things that failed to make it through the rift."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I imagine it's pretty dark down there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How large are these lodestones that we're looking for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We will show you these down in the Aerie tomorrow, but they're roughly--" and she gives a motion about that big in her hands. "About that large. But you can take time and research the ones "that are dwindling within the temple. That way, you'll know what to look for."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And in all your experience with these beasts, are their attacks mainly physical?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Mainly. However, they have a degree of control over the waters that surround them. Those "who have returned, the Waverunners who do these passes every few years, they speak of currents "swiftly changing, it leaving bursts of darkened ink-like material to obstruct the space. And they "speak of sudden surges of energy that rock through the nearby waters."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are there other creatures that live in the rift?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are creatures, but those of flesh and bone usually find themselves in the belly of the "beast, and due to the nature of its presence, and the rift's energy, elementals do occasionally "wander half-crazed, directionless in that space as well. So be careful."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. Is there a particular creature that you know is good at evading this kraken?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Our Waverunners. They travel usually in various forms of their mer-form."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Whatever that is to you, that's your choice."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keyleth, I know you have the ability to turn us into different things.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it possible to turn us into water elementals?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: -- that's not really a beast. I can turn you into--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like a great herd of dolphins that we can commandeer?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. And then just ride them--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The worst of like five worlds.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I know that Taryon and I can alter ourselves into merfolk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And you can also-- how many people can you imbue with your powers?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, could you give Alter Self to others?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, technically, I could. It would use a lot of my spell abilities, but I could give four of my little coins to people, and those coins could be used to alter yourself to be a water-breathing madman like me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, sort of. Just you, but with gills.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we want to be a mermaid, though?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, yeah, you could do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With the Alter Self, you can give yourself gills and webbed hands, and you would gain a swim speed of your normal walking speed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As she begins to talk about the--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This all she talked about from ages six to 13. Only thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (sings) We are the daughters of Trident!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (sings) I want to go where the people are.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could also think of a spell that would give you a clever Rastafarian crab sidekick.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, I like it. Oh, Trinket!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, okay. Gotta put the foot down before this gets weird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I agree. Let's talk about this over a Heroes' Feast. How's that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but a midnight feast like--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, 'cause that would waste a spell on the day.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keyleth? I don't think she's done talking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I would recommend taking some time in the water first. Learn how it reacts to you and you "react to it. Know that the limitations of not combating in air can be restrictive."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Makes sense. I don't know how my bow's going to work underwater.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know how my guns are going to work underwater.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have a training ground? Like an arena that's kind of comparable we can test in tonight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Tonight? We could escort you to one of the more deep areas in Vesrah if you'd like."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does it have to be tonight?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, yes, if we want to recover all our abilities for tomorrow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we want to practice now and eat later, or eat now and practice later?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Practice for an hour, have a midnight feast.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I hear you're not supposed to fight or kill anything for 30 minutes after you eat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So fight first, and then snack.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So fight first. Yeah, we shouldn't swim after eating.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Even that's a pretty big number for you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The beach drops down into about a ten, 15-foot depth. You can see this area is almost like a farming ground for bits of kelp and other sea plants that are just maintained for food.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we're doing this in the morning, right? We're leaving first thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys just said you were doing it before--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, no, no, no, yes. We're doing that, but we're leaving in the morning.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, we're leaving in the morning though, at dawn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, tomorrow is when you actually venture down to the Aerie.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: At dawn, we swim. Then I'm going to go ahead and cast Water Breathing on all of us now, because it lasts for 24 hours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So how many targets can you do with that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we still breathe on land?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think it's up to ten. Let me double-check. I'm pretty sure it's ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, don't worry. In older editions, there were arguments, because they didn't specify.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You have to sleep with a glass of water by the bed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so between all of you, including Trinket, you guys are able to imbue, for the next 24 hours, Water Breathing onto the party.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten willing creatures, perfect. Ah, Doty does not need it. Doty does not breathe. All right, so you guys, you feel this strange kind of sensation as the air seems to change in your lungs, but still function. It's a bit colder, and as you slowly submerge yourself in the water, you dip underneath, and the instinct is to hold your breath for as long as you can. It's that natural survival instinct, but the moment you give in and allow yourself to inhale you panic for a moment but then regulate, for a moment, and feel the water cycle through. It's cold. It chills the interior of your lungs a bit, but you can breathe fine. Speaking's still a bit of an issue. It's still a kind of a garbled-- there's no air passing past the vocal cords.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (garbled) I'm peeing. I'm peeing in the water right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we see under the water? How's our perc--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your visibility is as good as it would be underwater. It's murky. It's difficult to get a very clear view of anything beyond maybe a 20-foot span. Plus, this is nighttime. It's dark.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about Percy with his glasses? I mean, could we do some sort of goggle things, so we can see better?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could try to craft some goggles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So that we could see underwater.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, they are for close up, but they're not attached to my-- water could get in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you want me to hold your glasses again for you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would have to ask, probably, for materials to do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't have anything to craft goggles.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I'll put them in, I've got a pocket.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Crafting goggles. Would it be helpful to craft something that would allow us to speak? Or--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tary, you're really good at crafting, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am, I would say the best at crafting, actually. I've spent my whole life doing it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, could you make something like that in like an hour?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have no idea. But the adventure is to try, right? And I certainly will give it a go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My big question is, what am I going to do with my guns?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm going to try to shoot an arrow and see what happens.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, go find out, that's why we're here, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you pull back and release the arrow, and it does fire, but it fires much slower and is impeded. It only gets about half as far, and even then with a dull thud.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it-- It doesn't seem like it pierces any?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It functions, but essentially the-- and this goes for any ranged attacks, most ranged attacks I should say, and melee attacks are at disadvantage underwater.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And ranged attacks don't go further than their first range increment.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm gonna have to look up my first range increment

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So if you look at your bow, and it says like, you know, 60 feet, 120 feet, you know, for first increment, second increment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It just stops in the water.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I could throw it 20 feet at disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's as far as it'll go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Also, your movement speed is halved.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unless you have webbed fingers, or you know, use Alter Self

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can also change us whenever we feel like being something else.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It just takes a turn. Rock it like an electric eel!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do I find out how far a longbow can shoot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your firearms will not function underwater.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're not going to function underwater.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's okay. No, I'd be worried if they did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so for the longbow, your first range increment is 150 feet, so you're okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But anything beyond that, not functional.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So, all melee attacks are at disadvantage, because you're swinging through water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. Yeah, you're going against resistance in the water.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So there's no way to put a bubble around me or anything, is there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So you think if your bullets were to pierce out through this bubble, they could still go a ways.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or I could even put the tip of the gun out of the bubble.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, you can shoot into water.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And fire, but as long-- the combustion has to happen in air.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, be in a closed airtight space with a firearm, that will do wonders for your ears.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How do you even know all this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The firearm has to be enclosed, not you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But it would only last one shot. Blow a hole in the side, then water would get out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, if I could have it around just the combustion point, and have the barrel sticking out of the point, that might be a thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That might be something we could try to make, I suppose.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could take apart Trinket. That's your bear, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're not taking apart the bear.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's your robot bear. We could take apart that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's a real bear, Tary, he's a real bear.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Could you make some sort of cavernous hole out of Doty's chest?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, I've got a crazy idea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, I'll touch Doty, but--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We lure the kraken onto land.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I wanna build a watertight vest for the guns. Basically just a packet that keeps that section dry. Like a protective-- like a soft bag that is waterproof, that would use some sort of stomach lining of some animal or some leather to build it. I couldn't reload the gun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you'd probably only get one shot each.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One shot, or would it just be one shot-- yeah, 'cause it might--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, like it would-- just around everything but the-- well, the barrel would then have to be--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The barrel would then fill with water.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Respect. Can I imbue one of your mystical coins with one of my spells that we give to other people or is that kind of your thing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, sure, yeah. I'm sorry. I'm farsighted. So sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think that would work. It's sort of a thing that I can do and I'm pretty cool at it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I did not mean any offense.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: None taken. I respect the question and I respect you wanting to work with someone of my skill set and aptitude. I saw your work back there at the last fight and, well, the gunslinger was rendered useless and everyone else was fighting on the other boat against lesser allies. Uh, enemies, I mean. You and I held off that beast together and it was quite amazing to watch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, you're gonna take full credit for it later, aren't you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I made the kill. It was 100% mine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. No, that's fine. I mean-- you know--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But you were there and it was a good assist and I appreciate it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs weakly) Moving on. Back to planning.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to need some way of defending myself or I'm going to have to take an animal form.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could give you an animal form.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I may have to have an animal form.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's kind of small, isn't it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A little yellow fish. A little yellow fish that's very friendly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A very friendly yellow fish. I was thinking maybe some sort of half-octopus merperson.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But it is challenge rating four or lower, which is awesome. That's cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have a question for you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have two vials of underwater breathing from a long time ago. How long do those last?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have a question for you as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. What is your question?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We know that it can turn into a crossbow?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How many crossbow arrows do I own? Any?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're just regular bolts. They're bolts, not arrows.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we know if the kraken is considered Thordak-sized or, humongous?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have no idea, but the stories say immense.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They could take down a ship, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I mean, fairy tales tell about them pulling ships under the water, breaking them in half.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have a little poison bolt. Do you want one? I've just been holding onto it. If you have a crossbow?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I would love that. Thank you. How much do I owe you for it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's call it an even five gold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hm, I'll take it. I was just gonna gift it to you, but I'll take the gold.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I don't want there to be any sort of implied favors or anything that I have to return later. If you're all right with it, I'd like to just keep this business, thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do still want an Alter Self coin.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, are we doing that? I can do four of those Alter Self coins.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would that take away the speed halving? If we had webbed hands and feet, would that--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you'd then have normal speed through the water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the record, with swimming, you're essentially flying, too, I mean, as far as in water. You can swim in an up and down direction as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: When I'm an animal, none of my bonuses--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right. So, Boots of Feral Leaping, I don't really-- unless we're on the bottom of the ocean.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My bonuses stay. So, my vestige will actually--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I think so. Yeah. Yeah, yeah, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If the vestiges will be functional while I'm in animal form.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, we're still underwater, right? (garbled underwater speech)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're surfacing and talking and going back under.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The target can't activate, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So, you can't benefit from your equipment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does that negate all my class boosting and all that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you become a creature that has an armor class of 11, you have an armor class of 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Alter Self, you keep all your stuff and just gain the ability to swim underwater.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And it's our movement speed, which isn't very fast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct, but it's better than half your movement speed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which is really not very fast. So your call.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Could killer whales give us a movement speed of 60 swim feet?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He was into sharks, but he has something against whales.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but what if the kraken sees it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It says in the book that they are definitely faster.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe orcas, but they're not whales, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're not actually whales. They're orca.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They-- yeah, like with cool tattooing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You guys were down with manatees, but have something against killer whales? I feel like our priorities are off.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like, he can shark and I can whale.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, I know it's always been a waste of time, our planning, but we're not even talking about what we're going to try to do. Are we going to try to distract this fucker and take his lodes or--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, if we use Pass Without A Trace, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If we're all something super stealthy, we move super fast, get there, and get out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let me make sure Pass Without A Trace is not concentration.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Important question. Do we know if the elemental plane is more like the waters off the Cayman Islands and it's crystal clear for hundreds of feet or is it like more murky, boggish Louisiana, Gulf of Mexico-type water?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It seems like it's Marianas Trench levels. Seems like--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's pretty dark. From what you've heard and what they've talked about, the water elemental plane, most of it feels like you're a mile beneath the surface of the ocean.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have to be animals that can grab things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do have some visibility, though the source is difficult to really ascertain.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, I like this. She is smart.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The other half can ride them in our Alter Self forms like a SeaWorld show.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, yes, absolutely. I volunteer to be a rider or a captain of the ship sort of.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we throw a little bit of rope together, we can make some quick harnesses, including harnesses that include a little bit of a netting for the stones as we get them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A harness around the big man? I think that would be quite a formidable steed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You back the fuck up right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because I can Alter Self at will and you have to take a spell slot, or can you do it at will?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know what "at will" means, but I'm very impressed.

lines.name: GROG
lines.text: That's not a terrible idea, 'cause I'm gonna be able to do dick diddly shit in there. That's, like, zero.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It means one of us might have to borrow your bag of holding.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I'm out. I'll stay on the land.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tary, you had a bag of holding, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do we need it for? Oh, to put the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The things in that we're finding. Oh, yes, yes, of course and they would be great keepsakes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, well, if we find an extra one, perhaps I could take that back as a--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm obviously a fan of stealth, right? But when we go in there and it all fucks up like it does nine times out of ten and the thing sees us anyway, what are we doing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Without the lodes? With the lodes?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll try and hide and keep looking for them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But we don't wanna hurt this thing, so what are we doing? Interference and distract and a couple of us try to smash and grab?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bait. I like it. Way to volunteer, captain.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, nope, nope. New guy here, just a process question. I'm new to these sort of strategy "seshes" that you guys have. Is this how it always is, with people just throwing out random bad ideas constantly for, like, 15 minutes?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We do that and then we kind of take it like jazz on the day, you know?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there a chance that we might perish?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because it doesn't seem like we have a good plan right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, that's the thing about these sorts of encounters, is that any plan you have is pretty much going to be out the window the minute you see it anyway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If it makes you feel any better, this feels less asinine than many things that we've done before.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That does make me feel better.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's true. Half of us are animals, half of us are riders.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Half more a plan than we normally have.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I once teleported into the belly of a dragon with another jackass and that went tits up fast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That sounds like the stupidest fucking plan I've ever heard.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's much like those people who give you instructions of how to survive an encounter with a tiger. It's that, you think about it, but you've never actually met anybody who's said, "Yes, I've met a tiger, that's exactly what I did and I'm fine." No, anybody who does that's probably been eaten anyway. It's a terrible idea. You don't try and look bigger, you don't do any of that. You're gonna get eaten.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You survive an encounter by a tiger by running really quickly in the other direction or hopefully hacking it to death before it kills you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, just between you and me, this does sound really fucking stupid.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, it was just my suggestion.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So, if four of us are fast water creatures, right? Something that swims quick? What's our diversion? I volunteer as tribute.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, if you drop back down to zero hit points, you'll revert back to your normal form, being able to water breathe, full hit points.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That would be a bad case scenario, 'cause I'm really slow, in that case.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How many hit points does a killer whale have?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, god, I thought you said nine. I nearly shit my pants.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's see, what can we do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know if there's anything else better.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The thing is, the kraken might be able to swallow you whole, Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know how big they are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, but they've got-- Don't they have beaks, like a squid?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I didn't hear anything about a beak or a mouth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Who hasn't seen a drawing of a squid or a kraken in a fairy tale book? They're disgusting.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe-- we have one night. Maybe I could try and craft some sort of concussion explosive.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I also don't want you tired tomorrow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It wouldn't probably hurt it, but it would at least maybe shock it. Give it a-- stun it? To just blow something up underwater?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's something that I want to try really quick, if you guys could back up or maybe get out of the water. I want to see if I can cast spells underwater.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I also want to see what lightning does, so if you don't want to get electrocuted.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As soon as those two start talking about that, I get out of the water and start attuning the Deathwalker's Ward to lightning.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love that this is all under the assumption that we just had this planning sesh underwater.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm staying in the water because I wanna feel the lightning.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm gonna tread back from Grog, go underwater, and I'm gonna do a Call Lightning bolt. See what happens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, Call Lightning, let me check real fast. Yes, okay. So, you begin to speak underwater. (burbling noises) Spell isn't coalescing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's exactly what I wanted. All right, then how about this? I take out my Spire and I do a Chain Lightning out of the Spire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do Chain Lightning out of the Spire? As you concentrate on the staff, the lightning arcs out of the staff and ends up searing and burning a small section of the floating kelp vines that are wandering up there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: While I'm under there, I want to Beast Shape into a killer whale.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's really hard to swim in this vicinity, especially with the density of kelp in the center of this dip.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I goose Grog a little bit from underneath.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was watching, but not that close. That scared me, I'm sorry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's okay, it's an animal that already has a black eye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, with your strength bonus--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- you, (laughs), let's see. What's your strength bonus?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, so you take, we'll say, nine points of bludgeoning damage as Grog just smacks you in the nose.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To be fair, no worse than anything that happens to a killer whale at SeaWorld at that point.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I went there, I'm so sorry. It's been there, I'm sorry!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there some sort of Alter Self spell that--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My personal alignment is already so far down.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Were you gonna-- you were gonna check your speed or something?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I'm in like a tank.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Which is even worse, I know! This feels tactless, I'm out! (all laugh)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Shit got real on Critical Role.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like how SeaWorld is was what was our line. Of tactless.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. Oh no, I know what--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right Jesus Christ, let's move on!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know where my money is going at the end of the evening.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there an Alter Self sort of spell that could make you be able to speak underwater? Is there anything that you can do that allows for speech?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, if I do Alter Self--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you do Alter Self just now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let me actually try that. I Alter Self.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To be able to give myself--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Gills, and like, fins and stuff, and then-- now can I cast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, because there's still water passing through your throat and vocal cords. If you get a full breath of air, you can get one spell off. And technically, with your breathing the water underneath, because you already had the gills in, it didn't work. You get a breath of air, and you cast the spell as the air leaves your lungs, but once you cast the spell, the air is gone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about merpeople? How do they talk to each other?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there really merpeople? There are merpeople.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They have a different larynx system.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I deserved what happened below the table. Last weird question, would it be possible-- could I basically just make a bag of air that we could carry that she could breathe in and have to breathe it in before casting the spell. Is that nuts?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, if I may. The big fellow over there said that he had some sort of vials that you could breathe air out of. Is that true?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know if it pumps your guts full of air or anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's Water Breathing, it's the spell Water Breathing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, what about my Water Breathing--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: -- we should still be able to talk?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Water Breathing you can breathe the water, but when you still--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, but you can't go (garbled underwater noises).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- but you can't, yeah. It's still water passing through the vocal cords--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is the thing that you have?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- which doesn't have the vibration to make the same sound.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think it's a potion of waterbreathing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we use some sort of--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: -- cap, right? On Grog's jug. And it just makes air!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Could I speak into the jug-- clearly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was gonna say we could make a diving bell. But it would be very hard to travel with, but we could make a micro diving bell.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You guys, this is getting dumber and dumber. We will have a movement speed of one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's basically an upside-down pot that you stick your head in and you take a big breath of air, but the problem is moving with it is bad.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It'll go straight to the bottom.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And-- all right. Who's whales, who's riders?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess I'll be a whale. Or Trinket could be a whale!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, it needs to be one of you two.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You might want to go shark for one of them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Trinket needs to go in the necklace 'cause of the odd man out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought you were being a rider.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would love to, but, there's no one to ride.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can't we have two people on one whale? I feel like whales are very large.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Especially if it's just handles, if it's just like hanging onto a piece of rope.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, let's go eat food.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys make your way out of the small kelp farming area, eventually back to complete your-- you're doing a Heroes' Feast?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But like ice cream, and donuts, like a midnight snack kind of.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is the meal I was waiting on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, Marisha rolls for you guys--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: -- which I will roll for you right now, and we-- both are cocked. (singsong) Landed on the side. That one-- is that still cocked?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Take some of the dice out of your box.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Including Trinket, who scarfs up happily at the table.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No fear, no poison, advantage on saves, isn't it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wisdom saves. Advantage. No fear. No poison.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we supposed to go research the lodestones before we go to bed, right? The ones that are failing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, maybe we could do it in the morning?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The morning is what you were told.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Going to bring you to the the Aerie of Torrent.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are they heavy or are they light?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. As you guys are brought to your sleeping quarters, which are these semi-private huts elevated above the water, so they are actually about half a foot above the surface. You are each given a small chest, a soaked damp chest like the wood itself is just waterlogged through and through. As you open it, on the inside each of you receive what looks to be a leather band, with a circular stone affixed to the center of it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If this is going to make us be able to fucking talk underwater--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or if this is one of those--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Vox Machina, solving problems that don't need to be solved.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Solved-- making problems complicated for five years.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why don't we put it on and see what it does?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What do you do? There's a cluster of them at various--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does the leather band attach at either end?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has almost like a rudimentary belt clasp on both sides.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to put it around my neck like a dog collar, and I'm going to lay down in the water face first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, it warms as it touches the outside of the neck and it feels like there's a very loose-- almost a vibration to it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (distorted, vibrational voice) This is really cool! (all laugh)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I put my ear in the water to see if I can hear him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does transfer your voice through the water.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's awesome! What a waste of (sings) fucking time!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But does it remedy the spell problem?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Welcome to the cool kids' table, Tary.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys can talk under water. There is still a limitation to the distance you travel 'cause sound is, you know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, no sorry, the sound does travel further.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. So we have to be super quiet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, you also look within the case and each of them has what looks to be spherical, somewhat see-through domes of some glass-like material.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are also affixed with goggles, and you remember, looking back, you saw some of the people who were part of the troupe here, especially the guardians on the outside of the city, had the same similar goggle sets hanging around their neck.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hello, water-based culture, would you happen to have some goggles lying around we could borrow, maybe something that's to communicate underwater, I don't know?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (makes ding noises to mimic hitting glass dome)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nobody asked-- but they were provided.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These are standard given to the Waveriders, the guardians that look on the outskirts of Vesrah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We don't have giant domes on our heads.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I just thought of one thing for you, right? I went fishing this one time--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: -- and the lure that I had was really shiny and sparkly, like fish love sparkly things in the water. And I'm just noticing now that you are really shiny and sparkly kind of all over.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was actually just contemplating that, because you know how frustrated you get opening up a crab when you're going to eat it--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I lost you at like the third word.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I wonder, would it be ironic if the kraken gets frustrated trying to peel off the armor? It'd just be a wonderful irony. I'm so sorry, sir.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, that's funny, but it doesn't sound safe.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if we paint you in like black paint, or poo.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh yeah, and that will immediately go away--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, paint it is. Or tar.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe you should be a whale.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't like any of this. When I was treading water before, was it difficult in armor? Was it--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And if I were to remove my armor, would I be weak and squishy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's just more of a (heavy breathing). Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is shiny. Your armor is shiny.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if we put you, like, in a potato sack? So, you've still got your armor but it just doesn't twinkle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's not a bad idea at all.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He is not wrong, and that's not a bad idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have a robe, I have a robe.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can just wrap myself in my robe.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's not just as flashy as the armor though, is it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It has some colorful patches on it, yes. But they're not shiny.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if I stitch up the front?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just would hate for it to open up. I'm just gonna-- do you mind? If I just--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Stitch up the front of my robe?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I would, yes, thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I stitch up the front.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It'll be like a choir robe for you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thanks. I go fishing a lot.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you. This is going to be fun! Right? Tomorrow?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Technically speaking, we can't quite feel fear at the moment, can we? Or is it just a general malaise of fear? (all laugh)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I like, I like the latter. Malaise of fear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I start working on the robe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's, I mean, it takes you a while to get through the whole robe and get it done, and it's functional more than visually appealing. But you get the job done.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This reminds me of one of my caretakers when I was younger, stitching up some of my play clothes. It's a nice feeling. Thank you so much.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: While they're winding down, can I sneak away and see if I can find Uvenda?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure! It's not too difficult. She's in the same seat, snoring loudly, while two of her guardians stand at the side with their thin, polearm-like blades just watching as you approach, and she's just like (snores).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I turn to her guards and say, do I wake her up? Does she not like being-- I don't want to be rude! But I kinda need to talk to her and I'm only here for a few more hours, and I--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of them takes his bladed trident and hits her just gently on the side with the butt of it. She goes (snorts awake).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ah, that's how you do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She leans forward, putting on the presentation, but you can hear just that slight undertone of frustration. "What can I do for you?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh, yeah. I was just curious. I'm so sorry, first off--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Keep talking, please. What do you want?" (all laugh)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You mentioned that there were only remnants of my mother that came back. Was she defeated by the kraken, or do you think this was from another means? Do you have any more information on her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It does not take much to ascertain the nature of her end."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And you're sure of this? This is what the kraken does to people?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What it does to anything that crosses its path. It eats to survive."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hm. I was just wondering. If there was any other potential explanation or--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm sure there is. There are many potential possibilities for anything that happens. I only "have the information I was able to glean from the various scouts and teams."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Really? All right. That's not that long, really. Did she stay long?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A few days. Prepared for the journey much like you did. That was the last we saw of them."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. I was just curious. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I wish I had different news for you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you keep anything? From what you found?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Her head turns curiously. "I fear I did not."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We gave a quiet burial to what we were able to recover, but that's all."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I appreciate that much. Thank you for doing that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course, and once again, I am sorry for your loss, Keyleth."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. It's part of the duty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I should be getting my rest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, big day! Swimming! Lots of calories! I'm gonna go now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anything else you guys wish to do for the evening?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I'm gonna follow Keyleth back to our room.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you just follow me? Were you following me just now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I was waiting outside the door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh! All right, okay, yeah. Sorry. No, I'm good, I'm good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've seen the trouble behind your eyes all day, not surprisingly, yeah?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A lot, yeah. A lot riding on this, but-- A little surreal that we're here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, you are already a river to your people.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know that your life has built up to this moment in many respects. But your father is very proud of you. You've already done a lot. You silenced that dragon. You've done a lot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm just glad I have you all.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not big on monarchies and the like, but I liked him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And he let them inform his decisions, and tried to do what was right. And the questions you have, I think they speak to your character.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uriel was also blinded by his unknowance of a lot of problems, so I just hope I don't follow in his footsteps in that regard.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, all the matters is what we leave behind us when we go. You've already done a lot of good. And you've taught me to be happy again. I'm very grateful to you. So, thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you. For believing in me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Anyway, we should get some sleep. It's a big day tomorrow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. You know, I noticed, about a week ago? You were curious about my wings. I shoot them out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Heehee, hee. I pet them a little.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have one hour. Fade to feathers.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I just want Vax and Keyleth to do the original Superman movie dialogue while he and Lois are flying.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh god, that weird poetry! (all laugh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just like slow narration of Keyleth disembodied as they're both just flying over Vesrah at night.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have a thing just for you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think they went anywhere.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just for you! Pass that down later.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, so! Anyone else doing anything else?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm collecting some seashells, and taking a bit of a walk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You need it! You're dirty! (all laugh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (more disgruntled bear noises) It's various knots and seawater clusters--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's just not fun. All right, so morning comes to, the sun rises, it's a warm day. But the waters are crystalline and beautiful as soon as you step out. And since you haven't been here during the daytime, you can see it's a paradise-like existence. The sands that fall beneath the waves are white, just bright bleached white, and the entire city seems like the middle of this distant, tropical paradise. The islands that do kind of flank in a triangular position, as the islands of Anamn, they are just lush and green and dense. You see no signs of civilization built across them. They are just unending canopies that swarm these masses of land that break past the ocean's surface in the distance, but here in Vesrah, the city cluster, it's beautiful. The water has almost a turquoise-type shimmer when you see the areas that are deeper. And you see, in various sections, where the sand drifts away, the sandbank vanishes into the reef, and there you can see just an array of colors that refract beneath the water's surface, as a gentle breeze kind of blows through in sections.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to go to there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to spend the morning, before anyone else gets up, standing on the edge of the water and like letting my toes sink deeper and deeper as the waves--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Basically surfing across the waves in the distance, doing runs around the perimeter of the reef.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And they are wearing the same goggles and the same throat pieces you were given.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is part of the standard equipment that is given to the Waveriders as they check on the outside and the vicinity of Vesrah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That one looks like Keanu Reeves! And that one looks like Patrick Swayze! (all laugh)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (Keanu Reeves as Johnny Utah impression) He's not coming back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beautiful blue above you. What do you do to prepare?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. She's actually already waiting for you, as you guys-- she's been up, earlier than you were, and--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take some time in my morning prep to do a little meditation, and I take my flame hands and I do some like, traditional Ashari war paint, kinda thing, going on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If he hits zero, okay, I have a question.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If he hits zero hit points--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, you just have the base hit points of whatever creature form you take, and once you go to zero and revert back to yourself, or just revert back to yourself, then you have your hit points plus the Heroes' Feast.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And gameplay mechanics, can Trinket get walloped so hard that it passes all of his new form, plus Trinket form, and take him out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If it was a shit-ton of damage, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it possible to grab a spare set of goggles and choker, just in case?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Even as you approach, they're looking out in the distance. She says, "Yes, that could be certainly mustered." And she snaps her little gnomish fingers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And one of the guards wanders off, comes back a few moments later and retrieves an extra pair of goggles, and the throat bead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And it's called a throat bead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How many of us need my coins to become altered?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I need to be a whale.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So, riders, show of hands. Rider, rider?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I can just use Water Breathing and cast Pass Without a Trace on us, that's the only thing, is I can't do that if I have Alter Self.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, well then, I can just--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, if you cast Pass Without a Trace, it's a concentration spell--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You won't be able to swim very fast, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She can't use Alter Self and Pass Without a Trace.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is Alter Self a concentration spell?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. I could cast Pass Without a Trace, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there any seashells on the floor that I could find? Pretty shells?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've already got a small bag of them, if you want to keep them--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Alter Self is a what-level spell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you'd have to use one of your third-level spells to do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You didn't think of that, did you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Animal Shapes takes my concentration, so I can't do that. But you could cast it--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But if you get tossed from the whale, can you swim?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I can swim. What if you give me the coin--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And then you can use it if you need it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: -- and if things get hairy, then I use it, and then we drop Pass Without a Trace.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If it's hairy, we won't need Pass Without a Trace at all.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can go ahead and cast Animal Shapes on her, but it takes a turn, a round, for me to-- an action to change her into something else, so can I cast it on her, but leave her as Vex for now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not gonna be an animal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A creature different from herself. Of the beast variety.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 'Cause we need Pass Without a Trace for her, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, so I'll get a coin, I'll cast it, go in, if things get bad, I'll use the coin.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You can cast the coin. Okay. All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You know how to use knots, right, you can do some basic--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know every knot in the book.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The double-sloop. The reverse-cowgirl. I know 'em all. I've got the itsy-bitsy spider.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know the rusty trombone. I've got--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yep. Got the figure eight, the figure four, the hidden figures.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've got a bunch of 'em, yep.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good for tension. I'm also gonna grab-- I should not be allowed to drink this. I'm going to take you aside really quickly and give you the extra set of goggles and the bead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you want me to do with these? Just keep them safe?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just in case. I'm-- you know how I get with my hunches.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You'll know, if we need them, we have them. Just an extra set.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can you guys also track where we are based on them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We've recovered as many as we could from previous scouts that have fallen."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: For scrying, if you need it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bigly man over there, do you want a coin in case you lose your whale form?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take one just in case.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does he speak-- he speaks Common, right? He understands what I'm saying?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Make big, big hit, say 'Alter Self'--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's the matter with you? Why are you talking like that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was everything I could've hoped for.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He does speak Fucking-with-you. Very well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I guess I'll make four coins.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And pass them out to Percy, Little Elf Boy, Little Elf Girl, and Jumbo.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have you heard the Legend of Taryon Darrington?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: From you, yes, I have. It's a good tale.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can call her Vex. Some people call her Vax.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, you can call us by anything, we'll both respond.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Okay. Were your parents fond of you, because to name them that similar would be-- just quite annoying, growing up, you must've gotten confused constantly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see he's got very, very short dirty-blonde hair--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And a beard that is just tattered and knotted from not being kept or combed through.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So someone you would find at Venice Beach.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kind of, yeah. He's the Venice Beach dwarf, basically.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Straight-up, actually, now that you point it out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just finished going up the ropes and down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, I'm taking you down to the Aerie. You ready?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you gonna be with us the whole time, or are you just getting us there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I'm just getting you to the door."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, now we're really in trouble.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is where we're gonna check out the lodestones, before we go through the door.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, yeah. Knew it. Making sure you knew.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's doors to the other planes. That's our people's job.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my. Okay. This is great. This is great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You shouldn't be. Now, come on. See you've got your equipment." And takes his goggles and puts them back on. They're bulbous, they're just these giant domes that make you look fly-like.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you, Uvenda." "Of course. Take care of them." "That's not my job." And dives into the water.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, don't you have to make some of us--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, no, wait, how long does it last?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, 'cause we can do it underwater, can't we?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, let's wait until we're going into the water plane before we turn into fucking whales.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't we have to examine shit first? With our non-flipper hands?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, he's gonna be showing us the stones first, right? So yeah. Jesus. I go in first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you guys follow suit, diving in, diving in, each one of you in the order you wish, eventually with Doty (splash) just sinking very heavily down after you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can't-- nope, he's a construct.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you prefer Doty not to?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would prefer Doty not come. He can't swim, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, he can just walk across the bottom.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're not going to tell you what to do here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm a little confused. We're going underwater now, but not to where we're going for the mission?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The portal to the other dimension is underwater and through a rift.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, then Doty can come this far.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We barely knew him. Bring him along.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait by the gate. Like a butler.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It might be smart to not have him join us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The rusty Doty's another knot that you know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your plan? Yes or no?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Stay behind, and just take atmospheric notes, you know. Time of day, position of sun. Type of clouds. And if anyone tries to steal my stuff, describe them very well in the book.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's all for color, for the book, you know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Another one. Just taking very, very good notes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two chapters of seagull flight patterns.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're gonna have an excellent book on the mating habits of seagulls when you get back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eat your heart out, Darwin. Doty's on the case.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Further down, you see eels twisting through, and bits of kelp and other long, underwater plant life tickle your body as you push past and drift, keeping track of where you're slowly sinking down, desperately trying to follow this dwarf that is no longer in view, he just dove straight down and is far more comfortable under the water than most of you. Eventually, the reef begins to cluster in tighter and tighter, and you start getting a little nervous as to if you're going to hit a bottom or hit a pinch point. And then suddenly it stops, the reef just ends, and you now are floating down into what appears to be endless dark ocean. And just below, you see just a faint bit of light, and you start noticing the dark color is because you're about to hit an extremely dense forest of underwater plant life. You watch as all of these long, thin tendrils of almost vines covered in elongated leaves begin to curl up around you, and you start pushing through, following this light, and as you get across to the edge, Keyleth, you're the closest ahead and you guys have just enough light to watch the bead of where Keyleth is. Keyleth, you can still see Durent and keep that pace. He leads you down over this bank of where the top of this underwater forest ends, and you see, attached to the reef above by a single pillar of stonework that seems to be built or carved out of the reef, emerges a spiraling tower that eventually ends on the floor of the ocean here. It's made of a yellowish-white sandstone-like color, there are pillars carved out of it, naturalistic, but also have almost a series of bevelled edges to them. Within the inside, there is a dull green glow that is pulsating, and as Durent makes his way down toward one of the many openings in the floors, you can see there is a very, very faint sparkling energy that seems to just drift up out of the center of this tower. As you make it further down towards the base, you now begin to see through some of the openings, the center of this tower is hollow. It is an exterior, like a very thin Colosseum-like structure that goes up for multiple floors, slowly pincering as it gets to the top, and it is just an open interior inside. As eventually you touch down onto the soft bottom of the ocean here and begin making your way, slowly swimming towards the interior, you can see a number of other similarly dressed Waveriders as well as armored guardians that stand, all with various trident or spear-like weapons. A number of them appear to be of varying races, human, half-elf, elf, it appears that Durent is the only dwarf you see in this vicinity, and a couple of them appear to be merfolk, like straight-up half-human, half-fish, tails, fins, gills, the whole circumstance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does their hair look like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) You see two of them, one of which is male. No visible hair on him, actually, just the frill that goes down his head. The other is female. Long, deep, dark blue hair that drifts past, and as she shifts and looks in your direction, you watch it hold in place and slowly shift as the water currents push through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you can watch as occasionally clouds of black, murky soot or sand, deep, deep ocean sand, push through. You can see, as you get closer and peer in, this is a doorway into the plane, this is the rift. Unlike the one that you saw at Pyrah, which seemed to flicker and have a barely contained energy when you've seen it at its torn-open stages, this appears to be fairly contained. It's demure, there's not a lot of movement, it's just stationary, and the guards that surround it in the center of this temple all look inward, keeping vigilant watch. As you follow Durent, making his way towards the doorway, you can see within each of these three large, half-buried stones, there is a smaller, deep emerald green, almost jade-looking stone that is about that large that is embedded in each of these. Durent points over to one of them, and you hear him, through the water, the throat bead carrying the sound of his voice through, "This is "what you're looking for. This is a lodestone. Take your time, as much as you need, to study it. Find "what you need. Let me know when you're ready to pass through."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are they all the same color? Every lodestone looks the same?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you glance through, they're all the same color. Slight variations, and the shapes change a little bit, some are perfectly spherical, some are a little oblong, just whatever shape it eventually hardened into.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth goes up and touches one and meditates on it for a second.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you put your hand towards it, you feel a very, very faint vibration, actually a very similar vibration to the throat bead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Really. Are the throat beads green? Do they look similar?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, now? You notice, yes, they're made of the same material. You see that a lot of-- the lodestones' main purpose is here, but a lot of the inherent magic of them, or at least the enchantment properties of it, it's a pretty big part of the general life here at Vesrah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do the beads tend to react when they get closer to the lodestone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is no change. But you do feel that faint hum and vibration of power of the lodestone that is embedded within.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I turn to Durent. Whereabouts do they tend to be found? The lodestones?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You might have to dig. Mostly we find them buried."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let me show you." And he goes over and grabs one and (strains) and pulls it out. The doorway flickers ever so slightly. He's like, "It's fine for a moment." And hands it to you. You take it, and for its size, it is surprisingly dense. It has about twice the weight you were expecting, and your arms just (grunts) a little bit. Also, as you're holding it, you notice the clasp on your cloak is being pulled towards it. As you pull it away, and pull towards it, you realize these are actually fairly magnetic.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Magnetic. Percy, do you have a compass?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't, but I can fake one pretty quickly if we have to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do we even have you here for, I mean?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it possible-- well, we're too deep now, but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're having this conversation, you watch as Durent's patiently there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You have a compass, don't you? And I'm going to hand it back to him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, but I need the stone." Puts it back inside. "Okay, we're good."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If I examine it, do I detect any magic on it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. Profoundly magical, this is a very, very strong natural magic source.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is going to be weird. I'm going to take out a chunk of Whitestone residuum and just compare the color and see if there's any relation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But there are certain comparable facets of its ability, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It actually occurs to me that I might have some magnets on my person. Can I make an investigation check? I had quietly in my head been using them to keep my coat down when I was running around with the spider boots.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I wouldn't say it if it wasn't true.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I make a roll to see if I happen to have some on me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's fine. They're very simple magnets.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. They might help with-- I'm going to try and see if I can use them as a very base dowsing rod for these stones.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You notice that you don't-- any sort of pull you feel on the magnet doesn't seem to hit until you're within about a foot or so of the stone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I pull out my compass and see if it works.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you pull out your compass?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. Yeah, I have a compass, by the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you pull it out, you watch, as you stand there, it's confused, it's darting around and doing circles. As you begin to step in one direction towards one of the stones, it rights itself in its direction.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Will you keep that handy, you know?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, sorry. Yes. One second. Just, still pressurizing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In my head, you have zinc all over your nose. There's just zinc.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yes, do you want a--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, we're really pale people, this is probably a good idea. No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I tap it, because I've seen other people do that, and I feel like that's what you do with compasses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it seems to be a functional compass.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you want to be the compass man? Are you gonna man the compass? Be navigation?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Any other tests you brainy types want to do on these giant, green balls?

lines.name: TALIESIN
